intro: Liabum sublobatum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed liabum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Liabum sublobatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
